4.enb: Mii kir AKOONG’O kipaat nyoo nyoolchinii isōwu akipō WŌLOO KUUNOOMTOOY KEEY kōrōōyi pō coronavirus
4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

12.enb: Kuunoomtooy keey kōrōōyi nēē raal nta kung’alaal :chiich kupka ng’ula

13.enb:
Iryoong’ēē yoo lōōw.
Ryoong’ēē miita 2 si nēē ng’at iriip keey māpēēchiin ng’ulēēpō chiich
13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

17.enb: Nēē roo chiich nyoo roolēy / tirsyoonēy / mnyanaat
17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

18.enb: Tēē akwaaneek tukun choo tukēē keey sēr nkōō kuut. Muukēy kuroolchi nta kuutirsyoonchi tukuuchoochēē sikuriip piich walak choo lēēkitēēn
18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.

22.enb: Mā kēēlē mnyanaat :inyeentee, mii kipaat kuriipēy keey
22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

23.enb: Muukēy kimnyaanaat :chiich wōloo nyuun moomii kiyoo ng’uutuuy kilē mnyaanaat, akuunoomtooy nyuun piich kōrōōyi
23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

24.enb: Karaam imētoorēē keey wōloo mii  :piich chaa chaang’, āmu mēēmuukēy isōwu kilē ng’oo nyoo mnyaanaat
24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

28.enb: Tukun choo /kinyipirēy nkōō liipti nyēpō koropa

32.enb: nkōō mpōsaang’ nyēpō kir nyoo itukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

38.enb: Muukēy kupēēchi saayiitiis walak ng’ula chēpō chiich nyoo mnyaanaat tukun walak kilēē…
38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

42.enb: Nēē nam tukuuchu kimēēnkēt, aku nēē ng’at inam keey tokoch,
42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

43.enb: oor kipaat nyoo /kuuwoong’ēy kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi ku /kēēwuun tukuuchoochēē nkōō sāpuni nta /kēēpāyiisyēērō saakityaan nyoo /kuutiliilēē tukun.
43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

44.enb: Nēē nam :kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi tukun kitēpēē saayitiis choo ng’ērin
44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.enb: Kimeenam keey tokoch. (Nta inam chiich aka tokoch.) Nēē mārēy nama keey tokoch iwuun ēēruung’uung’ kukaraam kupok
51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

52.enb: Tēēnō saayit nyoo yāmēy keey /keetuum tuumi mwoorēy kilē, “Kumwooruun kōōnkēy apoonyoon āmu kaakisuwa ēēruung’uung’” kunyil ārēēny
52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

58.enb: Nēē koo keenam keey kimēēwāriisyō, wuunō kipaat ēēruunēkuuk kukaraam nkōō sāpuni
58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

59.enb: Nēē muukēē ku meenam mpō saang’ nyēpō kiyoonēē /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

61.enb: Kuutyaan nyoo āpuuy kōrōōy kinārēy nkōō or nyēpō kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut nēē /kuulaak kilōōwiit
61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

62.enb: Nēē nur kipaat kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut iwiirta. Kimeelaak kiyoonēē kisiir pērēētuu akoong’o!
62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

68.enb: Kimaaramta āmiisyō, tukun choo /ki-āmiisyēērēē nkōō tōwulō
68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

69.enb: Mēēmuukēy :chiich kutiing’o keey kipkong’ tokoch mpō ntā kuutyam
69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

70.enb: Nēē muukēē, ipāyiisyēērēē kipkong’ nyoo mā ēēr paani iyootēy akiikārēy kurkat.
70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

72.eng: and after being out in the public

74.enb: Wuunō ēēruunēkuuk saayit aka tōkōl nkōō sāpuni…
74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

80.enb: Nēē mārēy isōwu ng’al chaa chaang’ akipō kōrōōyi isooman yi
80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!

81.enb: Wōloo /kinyōōrchinii ng’aleek akipō wōloo /kiriiptooy keey kōrōōyi

82.enb:
Ng’aleek walak: Karaam /kēēriip tililin kilē wōli mwooruuy :kiitapuuni āmu nēē kituup kuutoorētēēch makuunaamta keey tung’wō nkōō kōrōōytiin walak. Nyoolchinii nyuun /keetuupa ng’aleechu pērēētuus tōkōl mpō nēē moomii kōrōōy.
Wōloo /kiikinyōōchi ng’aleechu: aku Kāmoosiichu sōmōk wōloo /kiikinyōōrchi ng’alēēchu kung’eeta /kēēsōwu akipō kōrōōyi pō COVID-19 ākōy ku-it 28/2/2020.﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.html﻿https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Ng’ālyoontēē aka: Nēē mārēy inyōōru ng’aleechu /kiikisir nkōō oor nyaa nyumnyum iwō yi: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart
Nēē mārēy yoochii piich walak: Ng’aleechu /kiikisir nkōō oor nyaa nyumnyum /kēēyoochinii piich kilēēn kupunuunō online, Whatsapp nkōō Telegram /akēēmuukēy /kēēng’usu /akeepeel kichaang’iit kilēēn sikēētō tēēnkō /akēēnēētiisyēērō nkōō kaaw, skul nkōō kaapkaasi.
Paani imārēy yoochi piih walak kimēēruutyēērēē ng’aleechu sōmōk:﻿1) Kimēētāsi ng’ālyoon nyoo ng’ulēy ng’aleechu nēē mārēy iyoochi piich walak.  ﻿2) Ng’aleechu /kiikisir nkōō oor nyaa nyumnyum ku mā pō mung’aara.  3) Nēē ng’usu ng’aleechu nkōō yoomēt imwaa kilē kiisirēy @weimankowart nta imwaarta kilē /kinyōōrchinii instagram com/weimankow
Nēē mārēy ipāyiisyēērēē nkōō oor aka tōkōl isoom: comicsforgood@gmail.com
82.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com

86.enb: Translated by Michael Yano, Edwin Suter, and Paul Kanda

87.enb: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow

bookText.enb:
Akipō kōrōōyi pō Coronavirus



Mii kir AKOONG’O kipaat nyoo nyoolchinii isōwu akipō WŌLOO KUUNOOMTOOY KEEY kōrōōyi pō coronavirus

Kuut
Sēruun
Koonyin
Kipēēchi chiich
Chiich nyoo karaam pōōr
Chiich nyoo mnyaanaat
Kuunoomtooy keey kōrōōyi nēē raal nta kung’alaal :chiich kupka ng’ula
Iryoong’ēē yoo lōōw.
Ryoong’ēē miita 2 si nēē ng’at iriip keey māpēēchiin ng’ulēēpō chiich
1
Miita 2
Tirsyaa
Nēē roo chiich nyoo roolēy / tirsyoonēy / mnyanaat
Tēē akwaaneek tukun choo tukēē keey sēr nkōō kuut. Muukēy kuroolchi nta kuutirsyoonchi tukuuchoochēē sikuriip piich walak choo lēēkitēēn
2
Kartaasi nyoo
/kuupuukēē sēr
NTA
Mā kēēlē mnyanaat :inyeentee, mii kipaat kuriipēy keey
Muukēy kimnyaanaat :chiich wōloo nyuun moomii kiyoo ng’uutuuy kilē mnyaanaat, akuunoomtooy nyuun piich kōrōōyi
Karaam imētoorēē keey wōloo mii  :piich chaa chaang’, āmu mēēmuukēy isōwu kilē ng’oo nyoo mnyaanaat
kātiiniit
Chiich nyaa karaam pōōr
Misiipi nyoo /kirātēē keey nkōō kari
Tukun choo /kinyipirēy nkōō liipti nyēpō koropa
Kartaasi nyoo kuupuukēē keey
Kikoompeen
Koompuuta nkōō siimuun
nkōō mpōsaang’ nyēpō kir nyoo itukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
kāriin choo /kināmēy paani /kiloong’ēy kōpō koropa
Moorinoo koompuuta
Kalaamuun
Kurkat
Ēēruunēkwaak
Muukēy kupēēchi saayiitiis walak ng’ula chēpō chiich nyoo mnyaanaat tukun walak kilēē…
ku āmuukēy āmnyoonchō :tōkōl
nta inam tokoch nyēpō choorweeng’uung’
iting’ting’ keey koonyin
Nēē nam tukuuchu kimēēnkēt, aku nēē ng’at inam keey tokoch,
oor kipaat nyoo /kuuwoong’ēy kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi ku /kēēwuun tukuuchoochēē nkōō sāpuni nta /kēēpāyiisyēērō saakityaan nyoo /kuutiliilēē tukun.
Nēē nam :kuutyaantaani āpuuy kōrōōyi tukun kitēpēē saayitiis choo ng’ērin
Sāpuni
/sikēēriip keey
Karaam nyuun /keetuup tukuuchu
Wuunēē sāpuni kuti it yi
Sāpuni
Kipkong’
Kimeenam keey tokoch. (Nta inam chiich aka tokoch.) Nēē mārēy nama keey tokoch iwuun ēēruung’uung’ kukaraam kupok
Tēēnō saayit nyoo yāmēy keey /keetuum tuumi mwoorēy kilē, “Kumwooruun kōōnkēy apoonyoon āmu kaakisuwa ēēruung’uung’” kunyil ārēēny
wuunō siiriin
nkōō sēkuuntēēn choo lēē 20
wuunō kwēēn nyēpō mooriin
wuunō saang’ nyēpō ēēruunēkuuk
/Kēēwuun kukaraam ku /kee-ir nee?
Nēē koo keenam keey kimēēwāriisyō, wuunō kipaat ēēruunēkuuk kukaraam nkōō sāpuni
Nēē muukēē ku meenam mpō saang’ nyēpō kiyoonēē /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut
ng’ul
Kuutyaan nyoo āpuuy kōrōōy kinārēy nkōō or nyēpō kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut nēē /kuulaak kilōōwiit
Nēē nur kipaat kir nyoo /kitukēē keey sēruun nkōō kuut iwiirta. Kimeelaak kiyoonēē kisiir pērēētuu akoong’o!
Pāyiisyēērēē kiichiikō paani ichārēy āmiisyō
Nyēpō laakwee
Nyēpō apoo
Nyēpō maama
Mārēy kuting’ēy :chiich aka tōkōl tōwuleenyiin
Kimaaramta āmiisyō, tukun choo /ki-āmiisyēērēē nkōō tōwulō
Mēēmuukēy :chiich kutiing’o keey kipkong’ tokoch mpō ntā kuutyam
Nēē muukēē, ipāyiisyēērēē kipkong’ nyoo mā ēēr paani iyootēy akiikārēy kurkat.
Kaaw
paani kēēchōōnēē wōloo chaang’ piich
Kitoomō a-am kir aka tōkōl
Wuunō ēēruunēkuuk saayit aka tōkōl nkōō sāpuni…
Nyēpō lēt
sāpuni
Riipō keey chiich tōkōl!
Riipō keey chiich tōkōl!
sāpuni
Nēē mārēy isōwu ng’al chaa chaang’ akipō kōrōōyi isooman yi
Wōloo /kinyōōrchinii ng’aleek akipō wōloo /kiriiptooy keey kōrōōyi
Ng’aleek walak: Karaam /kēēriip tililin kilē wōli mwooruuy :kiitapuuni āmu nēē kituup kuutoorētēēch makuunaamta keey tung’wō nkōō kōrōōytiin walak. Nyoolchinii nyuun /keetuupa ng’aleechu pērēētuus tōkōl mpō nēē moomii kōrōōy.
Wōloo /kiikinyōōchi ng’aleechu: aku Kāmoosiichu sōmōk wōloo /kiikinyōōrchi ng’alēēchu kung’eeta /kēēsōwu akipō kōrōōyi pō COVID-19 ākōy ku-it 28/2/2020.﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.html﻿https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Ng’ālyoontēē aka: Nēē mārēy inyōōru ng’aleechu /kiikisir nkōō oor nyaa nyumnyum iwō yi: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart
Nēē mārēy yoochii piich walak: Ng’aleechu /kiikisir nkōō oor nyaa nyumnyum /kēēyoochinii piich kilēēn kupunuunō online, Whatsapp nkōō Telegram /akēēmuukēy /kēēng’usu /akeepeel kichaang’iit kilēēn sikēētō tēēnkō /akēēnēētiisyēērō nkōō kaaw, skul nkōō kaapkaasi.
Paani imārēy yoochi piih walak kimēēruutyēērēē ng’aleechu sōmōk:﻿1) Kimēētāsi ng’ālyoon nyoo ng’ulēy ng’aleechu nēē mārēy iyoochi piich walak.  ﻿2) Ng’aleechu /kiikisir nkōō oor nyaa nyumnyum ku mā pō mung’aara.  3) Nēē ng’usu ng’aleechu nkōō yoomēt imwaa kilē kiisirēy @weimankowart nta imwaarta kilē /kinyōōrchinii instagram com/weimankow
Nēē mārēy ipāyiisyēērēē nkōō oor aka tōkōl isoom: comicsforgood@gmail.com
Akipō kōrōōyi pō Coronavirus


Translated by Michael Yano, Edwin Suter, and Paul Kanda
Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow
bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
Chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!
Main references for medical info:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com

summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19
title: Akipō kōrōōyi pō Coronavirus
